p.e: eclectic adj: selecting what seems best of various styles or ideas

body.p: Eclectic provides a modular configuration framework for Gentoo systems, aiming to centralise and consolidate existing tools. It has a command line interface, but nonetheless is quite friendly.

Eclectic is written completely in bash, including the modules. This language has proved ideal for this task, as Eclectic modules are easy to write, simple to maintain, and do not require specific knowledge of a particular language like C, Python or Ruby. Eclectic modules have a similar structure to Ebuilds.

Eclectic contains modules for altering the /usr/src/linux symlink, changing the Portage profile, a somewhat experimental but useable interactive module for updating CONFIG_PROTECTed files, a module for handling runlevels andthe init system, and many others.
Eclectic aims for ease of use and consistency between configuration and adminisation modules used within a Gentoo installation.
